ModuleDescription: While interpretations of language are influenced by context-specific factors, including speaker knowledge and intention, it is important to ask if there are aspects of linguistic meaning that can be analyzed independently of such factors. The study of semantics assumes that such an enterprise is not only possible, but desirable, if we are to properly understand how meaning can be communicated through language. The major topics covered include truth-conditional semantics, quantifiers, variables, variable binding and quantifier movements.
